comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits] freebmd.co.uk
Masters Edward Walter Mile End 1c 488 birth registered 2nd qr 1890
I cannot find a birth registration c1875 - estimated above. That would make him 40/41 at the time of his death. Not a good fit with the age of the soldier in the photograph.

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/62508825@N00/]
Having had a second look, think that you’re right about a birth year of 1875 being incorrect.
I’ve seen the Free BDM entry for a birth in the second quarter of 1890.
As such, the best match I’ve found in the census’ is as follows;
Born 1890, the 1891 census records him one year old and living with his parents William Thomas [b.1866 Clerkenwell, London d.1945 London] and Emily Maria nee Wells [b.1866 Stepney, London. d.1897] whom he had married at St John’s Bethnal Green on 25th December 1886, and older brother William Jnr. [b.1888 Mile End, London]. His father is the licensee of the Crown Inn [Beer House] 59 Alderney Road. [his grandfather had also been a publican].
The 1901 census records him still living at the same address with his father, his father’s second wife Vera [Hannah Vera] [b.1875 Steeple, Essex] whom he had married in the second quarter of 1899, Bethnal Green, and his sister Ethel Emily [b.1894] and a four year old nephew. George Pudney
The 1911 census records the family still living at the Crown Inn, Alderney Road, along with his father, father’s[second] wife, and the second wife’s mother Hannah Heard Pudney [b.1839 Essex]. Edward’s employment is recorded as Bar Assistant so is working in his father’s business.
The premises of the Crown Inn still survives although no longer a pub.
